hero.subtitle: Tango Singer
bio.title: About Ana
bio.p1: Born in Berlin, Ana Fonell completed her acting and vocal training at the State University of Music in Frankfurt/Main and the Westphalian Drama School in Bochum. Even before her studies, she performed as a singer with her own musical settings of poems by Jacques Prévert as well as with international folk songs.
bio.p2: In addition to her theatrical work, her special love was poetry in connection with music. Over the years, she created a number of musical-literary productions with which she toured throughout Germany and abroad.
bio.p3: The text interpretations are a significant part of Ana Fonell's musical expression. She sees herself as an interpreter, drawing not only on her singing but also on her acting experience.
bio.p4: In Argentine tango, Ana Fonell has discovered a genre in which text and music, like in chanson, are of equal importance and where both popular and literary elements have found their expression.
bio.p5: The theatrical gesture of tango is as appealing as the variety and liveliness of its musical rhythms, which also invite new interpretations of traditional models.
